title: baristor
author: baristor
content: Looking for a trusted exchange in the past there used to be so many now days I cant find and sometimes the ones which are there dont work.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: baristor on April 27, 2023, 07:52:14 AMLooking for a trusted exchange in the past there used to be so many now days I cant find and sometimes the ones which are there dont work.If you're looking for a P2P exchange, I recommend (and use) Bisq.network.  In fact, I've been using Bisq almost exclusively.  You won't be able to pay with a credit card, but if you have an American or European bank account there are plenty of options.The popular centralized exchanges like Binance (or BinanceUS for US residents) or Coinbase do accept credit cards, but the fees are significantly higher than transferring money from your bank account.  They are as trustowrthy as any CEX can be, for what that's worth.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: baristor on April 27, 2023, 07:52:14 AMLooking for a trusted exchange in the past there used to be so many now days I cant find and sometimes the ones which are there dont work.Check bestchange.com, (I wear their link in my signature). They do monitoring many exchangers, and you will very easily filter any type of exchange you want.you can also always ask for assistance here in their ANN https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3309245.msg62025880#msg62025880
